title: Junior Python Developer
description:
Junior Python Developer (Student/Entry-Level) — Build Real Products in a Small, Fast Team

Job Description

We’re hiring one student developer who wants hands-on experience shipping real features in production.

You’ll work directly with the technical founder on early-stage software products in a small team environment. You’ll own features end-to-end, learn modern tools, and get experience you can talk about in future internships or full-time interviews.

We move fast, deploy often, and give you real engineering responsibility. If you want to level up quickly, this is the right environment.

If you prefer giant teams, minimal responsibility, and slow pace—this is not a fit.

Responsibilities

You will:

Build and maintain backend API endpoints (Python)

Work with cloud infrastructure (AWS)

Integrate 3rd-party APIs and services

Help design and scope features with the founders

Write clean, documented code

Deploy new features to production environments

Debug, test, and iterate quickly

Collaborate in a tight feedback loop

Every week, you will:

Ship something

Learn something

Demonstrate progress

What You’ll Learn

FastAPI (or Flask)

AWS Lambda, EC2, S3

Docker workflows

Database schema basics

Software deployment and CI/CD

Feature scoping and product thinking

Working within real startup constraints

Reading and writing documentation

These are career-accelerating skills.

Minimum Qualifications

You should have:

Basic Python experience

Git/GitHub familiarity

Comfort using the command line

Curiosity and willingness to learn

Ability to research and solve problems independently

No prior internship experience required—projects matter more than resumes.

 

Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have)

Experience with any of the following is a plus:

FastAPI, Flask, or Django

Docker or containerization

Cloud deployments (AWS)

React or frontend frameworks

SQL databases (Postgres, MySQL)

Not required—we will help you grow.

 

Who This Role Is Perfect For

Ideal candidates:

Are self-taught, bootcamp grads, or CS students who build outside of class

Enjoy shipping, not just studying

Love debugging and problem-solving

Are excited to work on interesting projects

Want product experience, not just code assignments

Thrive in small, focused teams

If you have personal projects or GitHub activity, we want to see it.

 

Who Should NOT Apply

People who only want repetitive tasks

Students who require handholding

Anyone who disappears when stuck

People not interested in continuous learning

We value ownership and curiosity

 

Hours & Commitment

~10–20 hours per week (flexible around school)

Remote friendly

Semester-long with extension potential

Output > Time spent.



Compensation

Paid opportunity. Exact rate based on skill and velocity. Strong performers receive increases and long-term pathways.

 

Why Work With Us

You’ll get:

Weekly mentorship from a technical founder

Production-level portfolio applications

Resume-worthy bullets

Fast career acceleration

Tight feedback loops

Real ownership

This role gives students the experience most internships do not.

 

Application Instructions (Important)

Please submit:

Your GitHub (required)

Links to 1–2 projects you’ve built (deployed preferred)

A short response (3–5 sentences) explaining:

Something technical you learned recently and why

Your weekly availability

Applications missing these items will not be considered.
